website_summaries.verdict: A smooth-running yet highly durable machine that can stand up to thicker materials.
pros: Features a heavy-duty, well-built aluminum body
The motor is highly durable and breezes over thick material like vinyl
cons: Snap-on presser foot holder is delicate and can break easily

customer_reviews.title: repaired machine 15 times since 2015... its a sign...
customer_reviews.text: Ok i've been using this machine since 2015 and its been a HUGE pain in the ass. bought it because it was sucha sturdy rated machine, just needed it for a zig zag stitch, straight stitch, and embossing edges. this machine can push through material but its also going to push so hard that it's going to mess with the timing and make the thread grabber skip everytime. have to repair it. cost 35-50$ each time. works for 2 weeks of sewing and then breaks again. breaks tons of needs, just sucks. I HATE THIS MACHINE. i'd return it 100% get anything else... seriously. get a 150$ machine and enjoy your life.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s all metal parts.
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine. It sews light to heavy fabric like denim. It’s awesome. Then again, I’m no expert with sewing or sewing machines. I got it to learn to sew, but it’s easy to use and instructions make it even easier. My mom is an expert at sewing and even she loves using this one... she’s old school, doesn’t really care for fancy models, has owned an all-metal parts Singer machine for decades which still handles just fine, too. This Janome is not fancy or digital like modern models, it’s a more basic model, but it does a great job regardless. I’ve had it for over two years and so far haven’t had a single problem with it.
customer_reviews.author: Madaboutbooks

customer_reviews.title: Total Junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought one and had to return it immediately because of horrible nesting. Based on the reviews I thought it was a fluke and had a replacement sent. Amazon did great and sent it out right away. The second did the same thing. After researching on you-tube, it looks like the timing is off causing nesting and broken needles. It seems the most recent reviewers are having the same problem. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Lee Bandel

customer_reviews.title: Does not work properly
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this machine and read all the information so I could work it properly. I have used sewing machines for the last 45 years and had my last machine (not a Jamone) for over 20 years. I decided to try this machine because of all of the good reviews it had. I have had nothing but multiple problems with it and have only used it for two days so far. It still does not work properly. It is not that I do not know how to problem solve sewing machine issues because, like I said, I have been using sewing machines for 45 years. I would like to get my money refunded.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Grey

customer_reviews.title: Worst machine I’ve owned
customer_reviews.text: By far the WORST machine I’ve ever used. From being nearly incompatible with cone thread, to a hard to use needle threader, clunky operations: it’s a mess. Barely usable on stretch and knit fabrics, and will un-thread itself nearly every time you begin sewing. Skipped stitches on every kind of stitch minus a straight stitch. A complete disaster, NOWHERE worth the price. The HD motor had trouble going through four layers of thin canvas. Save the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan D.

customer_reviews.title: Very cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: We are returning this brand new machine. First, the presser foot mechanism came in several cheap plastic pieces with no instructions on how to assemble. When we finally figured out how, the foot would not stay on due to the flimsy plastic lever. Then, when we were able to keep the foot on temporarily, the material advance dogs stoped working. The Janome web site is poorly constructed and offers no help or phone number to inquire for help. THIS IS NOT A HEAVY DUTY MACHINE. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: CATHERINE THOMPSON

customer_reviews.title: Janome is new to me
customer_reviews.text: My mother taught me to sew when I was young many, many years ago. Thankfully she was available to help with the tension and changing the pressure foots. We still can't figure out the needle threader, gratefully I can manually thread a needle. My mom has owned Singer and Brother machines. She was impressed with the Janome. She is a beautiful seamstress and now an accomplished quilter. If she likes my machine, it a great compliment to Janome.
customer_reviews.author: WLOLx3

customer_reviews.title: Perfect machine for general, all around sewing!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful, versatile machine. Unless you have specific specialized needs, this is all the sewing machine you will ever need. It is definitely capable of heavy duty sewing, but it also handles delicate work with aplomb. I am not a person who thinks having 118 specialty stitches on a circuit board makes a sewing machine better. The 18 stitch selection afforded by this machine are more than I will probably use -- plus, if repairs are ever needed you will not have to mortgage your house to afford them. The design of this machine goes back many years and it is proven and perfected. Buy one today and you'll thank me.
customer_reviews.author: M. Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Good machine
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that that they switched the bulb to led. I have this same machine from 4 years ago and it was regular incandescent. The led is a more blue color, and the smaller more concentrated light reflects off of the foot of the machine more and bothers my eyes as I am sewing. The only reason I bought a new one was to have a spare for when the other is in for maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Timing bad, had to have it repaired twice already, since purchase in 2016, and still having issues. Only use it occasionally too. Not worth the money. Have to mess with it every time I try to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Schall

customer_reviews.title: Good heavy duty machine
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a heavy duty machine to sew through layers of denim.; This Jarone machine works better than my old heavy duty Singer. which would alway break the thread or jam. I have been sewing tons of maks with no problem Only which the housing was metal instead of plastic. The bobbin cover is also plastic and God forbid if is lost or breaks.
customer_reviews.author: G H

customer_reviews.title: Nice Machine. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great machine. Easy to use...threading, bobbin refill etc. It has storage in the machine for the pressure foots and other accessories. Stitching is really nice. No computers to try and understand. Sews leather. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon P

customer_reviews.title: Best machine I have used in a long time
customer_reviews.text: Quieter than the White Sewing Machine I had. So far the only problem I have had is that twice the thread came off the thread take up lever and took me a bit to figure out why it wouldn't sew right. But as soon as I figured it out had no other problems. Goes over seams very well and elastic whereas my White kept getting stuck, which is why I ended up purchasing a new one. I have been making the face masks and this sews so much easier than my old machine. Worh the price for a quality product. Would purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Carol Ann

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Machine!
customer_reviews.text: Great machine! I've been wanting a heavy duty machine since my last denim sewing project. This machine went through 8 layers of heavy denim without an issue! The machine has good weight to it so it didn't budge or shimmy while sewing those 8 layers. I've sewn many projects with a Singer Prelude - it did the job but, it just couldn't make it through the denim without a struggle. This Janome HD3000 will be my go to machine from now on. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: SW411

customer_reviews.title: Bobbin Winder does not automatically stop.
customer_reviews.text: Generally sews fine. It’s easy to thread. Bobbin winder does not automatically stop when the bobbin is full. Is there a fix for this?
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen L.

customer_reviews.title: Solid Amateur's (or pro's) Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: Saw this machine in Adam Savage's workshop when I was looking for one. No regrets! Flawless tension and (near) silent running, inspires confidence in the novice.
customer_reviews.author: W. Swanton

customer_reviews.title: Great workhorse machine!
customer_reviews.text: I had this exact machine and it lasted 30 yrs. I make slipcovers and window treatments so I need a machine that can handle heavy fabrics. I had exceptionally good luck with the first one and this fit right in my sewing table so that was a huge bonus. No learning curve....just like sitting down with an old friend! Sew and go! Great value for such a well made machine. Looking forward to another 30 yrs. with this one....
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Machine!
customer_reviews.text: This Sewing Machine is very lightweight and easy to use. I have been sewing off and on for most of my life and am now in my 60's and I wouldn't be able to move a heavier machine so this is nice to have one that is lighter! My last one was too heavy for me to lift up to my table. I really like this one!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Law

customer_reviews.title: Amazing machine
customer_reviews.text: I love love this machine. I'm making masks in bulk, and this amazing machine goes over the thick pleats like it's nothing! The only problem I had was when I was going through all of the buttons and switches, I flipped the switch to put the feed dogs down, when I went to flip them back up, nothing happened. I had to open the plate where the feed dogs are, and manually pull up the feed dogs, and hold them up while I flipped the switch again to hold them up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A tough workhorse
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. It's a tough workhorse that just doesn't quit. It easily goes through multiple layers of fabric and webbing together.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a sturdy hard working basic machine. Love It!
customer_reviews.author: gilraen

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Versatile - Great For Sunbrella Fabric
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine for sewing thick Sunbrella canvas for my boat. My last machine couldn't get through more than 4 layers. Using a walking foot, size 18 needle, and V-92 polyester UV thread, this one plows through 6 layers. I added webbing on top of that and, again, it sewed smoothly through it all. I like that it can also handle lighter fabrics. If you're looking for a machine that can do it all, this is it!
customer_reviews.author: NOLA Sailors

customer_reviews.title: Great machine with some limitations
customer_reviews.text: Great machine with some limitations. The thread spool holder is small, my large thread spools would not fit. Also there is no good way to transfer thread from large pool to the smaller one that would fit - I would be saving smaller holders and manually transferring the thread from this point on. Inserting bobbin into the case is also painful - I had to use a tweezer to get it just right. The bobbin winder auto stop also did not work, when auto stop finally kicked in, I could not use the bobbin because it would not go into the bobbin case.
customer_reviews.author: S. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great machine, I did purchase to sew leather and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great machine, I did purchase to sew leather and it can sew lighter weight leather, but I will need a better machine which will cost a lot more in order to do thicker leather.
customer_reviews.author: M.D.

customer_reviews.title: Worth every dime!
customer_reviews.text: A little learning curve but the more I use it the better I like it. Give it time. This thing plows through everything I put under it thickness wise. Goes from thin to thick without skipping a stitch unlike my last machine. I debated this or a $1,000 machine and glad I went with this one. I did purchase a extendable table for it since I wanted support on the left side for my heavy items.
customer_reviews.author: MaryM2010

customer_reviews.title: Stuck in reverse
customer_reviews.text: My machine was stuck in reverse. I understand from the technician (at an authorized Janome repair location) that numerous HD 3000 machines have come through his shop with this issue. My mistake was not opening the shipment within the return window to discover this problem. Now I have to foot the cost of the repair--I understand that is my error, but this apparently is a known problem with these machines. So beware!!
customer_reviews.author: Can't wait to move forward with sewing!

customer_reviews.title: Not Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: After using this machine for several months, I can say with certainty it is NOT a heavy duty machine. It constantly jams on anything more than 2 layers of fabric. It's an OK machine, but definitely not what I consider heavy duty. It is no more heavy duty than my $125 Kenmore machine. I wound up getting a 1954 Singer Model 66 from e*ay and it sews circles around this machine in heavy and multi-layered fabrics.
customer_reviews.author: Danweis

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: I bought the machine to make face masks for the virus. Doesn't like any thread heavier than #46. Jams easily. Will not sew over a several layer hem without problems. Like the electronic foot control. Width and length adjustments must have been dreamed up by a novice engineer. Do not like the thread spool holders on any of this size machine. Machine has trouble with thread spools being fed from a thread stand. Tried Singer digital and this Janome mechanical. Prefer the Janome. Both are just TOYS
customer_reviews.author: Marion Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Great model!
customer_reviews.text: Best one I have yet owned! Truly an amazing sewing machine, easy to use, very nice strong motor, quiet in comparison with the HD1000 model. Just absolutely love everything about it!
customer_reviews.author: E. Davydenko

customer_reviews.title: Buy in person so you know what youre getting.
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine but it broke before 1 year of even owning it! And because I bought it on amazon I didn't have the store where I live so the warranty was pointless. It would have cost me more to send it to get fixed then to fix it. I ended up paying $200+ to get it fixed at the only certified shop in Hawaii and it's still making weird noise when I sew.
customer_reviews.author: KAF

customer_reviews.title: Work horse sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: This machine sews great! I was using a Brother before this one, and the Janome out performs it by a mile. Very heavy duty and sews over thick fabric. Love that the bobbin thread has the perfect tension and the stitches are beautiful. Only wish the threader piece was not made of plastic. My other Janome has a metal threader piece.
customer_reviews.author: maria r.

customer_reviews.title: She likes it
customer_reviews.text: Bought machine for my cousin in NY as her other 2 needed repairs. She really likes it and has been doing a lot of projects with it. Only thing that was bad is NY’s sales tax that Amazon is doing to everyone now.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Dunkerley

customer_reviews.title: Very nice machine.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice machine...I do a fair amount of upholstery, and it was able to handle the fabric easily, I did buy a “walking foot” attachment... that helps a lot to help feed the fabric evenly.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Y.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy-Duty Is What It's About
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine for my wife and she is pleased with everything about it. It's all about the heavy-duty capability. She rides horses and maintains her equipment using this machine. The features and capabilities are just what she wanted in a sewing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: Did not serve my purpose, even thought it stated that it would sew through several thicknesses, it didn't. I also have a lightweight Janome and it does not sew as I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Elodia Slosson

customer_reviews.title: A fine heavy duty machine
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Janome and I love it! I am a quilter and the thick binding is not a problem for it. The ONLY negative is, there are no bolt holes in the base for attaching to my sewing table so I cannot fold it into the table when not in use. A small price to pay for an excellent machine!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Quality In A Lite Weight Body
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy machine that handles the heavy weight layers of fabric, vinyl, and denim with no problems. It will go over varying heights of fabric and seams with no dragging and sews smoothly, regardless of the thicknesses. I am very, very happy with this purchase and wonder why I waited so long. This machine should keep me sew happy for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Linda W

customer_reviews.title: Excellent features and a very easy-to-understand users manual
customer_reviews.text: I've used this machine for two months now to make purses, and have yet to find a thickness of material that this machine won't sew thorough, without hesitation. Excellent features and a very easy-to-understand users manual. A great machine, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: diane h tignor

customer_reviews.title: If you want a machine that SEWS and doesn't cost a fortune....this is it.
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine. It sews!!!! That's all I need, I don't need a computer, or a bunch of digital push button thingy ma-bobs that make it confusing. I needed a machine that would sew think fabric and not be fussy about things. Thread it up...pick your stitch and go!!! That's what I like...
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Machine works great and stitches threw multiple lays of nylon webbing and ...
customer_reviews.text: Machine works great and stitches threw multiple lays of nylon webbing and foam. Giving it 4 stars because of the "free bonus kit". The bobbins that came as a free gift did not work with my HD3000. I tried three different bobbins from the free set of bobbins that claim to fit all but 1600p machines. The bobbins where a tad smaller and had a slightly different shape. I wasted 3 full bobbins of guterman tera thread, they all would wind way to loose. The ones that came with the machine seem to be working no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Allen

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful everyday machine
customer_reviews.text: Perfect basic machine and sturdy for all my sewing projects
customer_reviews.author: patricia

customer_reviews.title: Be careful
customer_reviews.text: Poor performing motor. Either made or stored poorly. This was my second time purchasing this model. Very disappointed. Replacement took way too long to arrive.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Jim great mach
customer_reviews.text: A heavy duty mach that is not computerized yet is a great thing , I'v used it a lot and with proper adjusting and a good ear this mach works as advertised. Even the bobbin winder works ,IF you take the time to adjust the tensioner correctly ! . This is a great machine and your kenmor attachments bobbins work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: It's like comparing the sound of a Ferrari to a Pinto
customer_reviews.text: I don't sew, but my wife absolutely LOVES her new machine. I can tell the difference between the sound of this one compared to her old Singer. It's like comparing the sound of a Ferrari to a Pinto.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Welte

customer_reviews.title: Only ran in reverse
customer_reviews.text: After I receive the machine and set it up, it only ran in reverse. Tried going online for trouble shooting and found it is a common problem with these machines. Return to seller
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Great machine!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this machine for about 6 months now its handled every project perfectly!!
customer_reviews.author: TLC

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine, goes through layers of canvas and outdoor fabrics like a charm. And it is NOT computerized, it is simple and a dream to use.
customer_reviews.author: island painter

customer_reviews.title: Nice buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy a separate holder for the thread because it kept getting bunched up. Now it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Cyr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best sewing machine! love it! Easy to use, and the directions are clear. Came well packaged, and as expected.
customer_reviews.author: MDC65

customer_reviews.title: A good choice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one based on it's design..no silly graphics, it's description, and it's weight. I like a solid, sturdy machine. Looks nice sitting on my table where I hope to actually find some time to use it someday soon. This is my second experience with Janome. As a middle school/ high school art teacher, we used a very similar model in my art classroom for several years. Our Janomes were strong, simple to operate, versatile, and very intuitive on fabrics of all weights as well as layers of paper and vinyl. The boys especially loved this since a) it was a power tool, and b) it had an "accelerator".
customer_reviews.author: LOLinLOL

customer_reviews.title: Its not as HEAVY DUTY AS YOU WOULD THINK
customer_reviews.text: Love it, now need to learn how to use it. I thought, where it said it would handle leather etc. It would allow Thicker depth of material under the foot would be able to fit, making it a "HEAVY DUTY" Machine, but it is NOT as Heavy Duty as it claims. I can not get leather fit under the foot, even with the additional accessories i purchased. I am hoping a friend who knows a lot about sewing machines, can help me out. Wish me good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen M Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Janome Heavy Duty Machine
customer_reviews.text: I love this sewing machine. It sews through multiple layers of paper and canvas, wax, etc. This machine is exactly what I was looking for, it's a quality sewing machine. I also love the top panel that has the 'cheat sheet' of the different stitches and settings, with the tension guidelines for each type of stitch. The instruction manual also has easy to understand pictures and instructions. I have gone from sewing 4 layers of canvas to then sewing tissue paper, and it does just fine. I would definitely recommend this machine to anyone, and would buy a Janome machine again.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This machine is a beast! In a good way:). At first I was surprised that it had fewer automatic features found on my smaller Brother machine. It turns out I don't miss any of them! I use it for making purses and it has a beautiful stitch and it never bogs down.
customer_reviews.author: Julie in Reno

customer_reviews.title: No Regrets With Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is solidly built and is affordable enough. I like the fact that it is not a computerized sewing machine.i am pleased with this purchase and have no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Daba1968

customer_reviews.title: ... bamebrands of the past made in china with very poor quality! We purchased this OUTSTANDING
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing other bamebrands of the past made in china with very poor quality! We purchased this OUTSTANDING, HIGH QUALITY, JANOME Sewing Machine EXCELLENT TOP OF THE LINE PRODUCT, AMAZON DELIVERED ON TIME
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great machine, great price
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. Getting used to a few basics that differ from the machine I've used for 30 years. The lighting would be better if positioned centrally; as it is, there's shadow to the right of the sewing area.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Janome HD3000
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this machine! I have already started to use it. I was looking for a heavy duty machine that would be able to handle sewing purses and quilting as well as regular clothing sewing. This machine does all that. I love the top that hides the thread and bobbin winder. I am still working on perfecting the auto threader but that is minor and I just need a little practice and patience to read the directions! All in all I am thrilled with this machine.
customer_reviews.author: WMD0926

customer_reviews.title: I love this machine
customer_reviews.text: I have a home embroidery and sewing business. My sewing machine of 30 years finally gave out on me, so after a lot of research I decided to try this one. Although not too heavy this machine is solid, quiet and sews a beautiful stitch. I love it and would recommend it for occasional and home based business users.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for those who do not want a electronic machine
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a well made machine, and does a professional job.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph B. Strong

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Sews through heavier fabrics and layers with no problem. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Huey

customer_reviews.title: Returned machine
customer_reviews.text: The stitching worked well but the bobbin continued to jam causing continuous problems. After trying for two days to make a buttonhole with the automatic R foot I gave up. I researched online to educate myself of problems but never was able to make a buttonhole. The machine would stitch in one spot without moving or it just stitched straight without stopping. The machine would never stitch backwards as it should have done to creat a buttonhole. I hav e given up and returned the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jo Warwick

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth It!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money! So quiet compared to the Singer machine I used to own. This machine was easy to figure out right out of the box! It is sturdy and well made. My only complaint is the white turns black due to fabric resting on it and human contact. I have tried to clean it, but it will only continue to stain. Overall... I am very happy with it and will never purchase another Singer machine again! This Janome works like an industrial machine in the way it is easy to handle on large jobs. Well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: modern7

customer_reviews.title: Did not disappoint
customer_reviews.text: Great machine, so far. I wanted the most machine I could get on a budget. I didn't need the electronics (just something else that can go haywire) and I didn't need 200 stitches. What I did need was a heavy duty machine that could handle yards of seams and one with the versatility necessary for quilting and appliqué. If you're okay with simplicity and want a standard machine to hone your sewing skills, learn to sew, or just as a backup for more advanced sewists, this machine is a great choice. I was afraid I wouldn't be able to lift it, but unlike my old Singer, the Janome 3000 is very manageable weighing a sturdy 31 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Julieann T

customer_reviews.title: Finally I have a great machine!
customer_reviews.text: I'm someone whose had no luck with sewing machines, I decided I didn't need one with computerized functions so after much research, decided on this one. I love it, it's easy to use and comes with all the feet and easy guide for whatever your sewing. The needle threader works great as well and very easy to use. I've made several items with it and find I'm enjoying sewing now after so much frustration with other machines. This has a 25 yr warranty.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine
customer_reviews.text: Good Machine could have been a little improvement on the feed dogs they will not return with switch when lowered. They are supposed to raise with a switch but I have to manually raise feed dogs after lowering. This causes problems when trying to use for quilting then returning to regular sewing. Libby
customer_reviews.author: Marvin Long

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying my new machine and it does everything as promised!
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Sews like a dream
customer_reviews.text: This is my rating, so far. This is only my second machine in my life. I was hesitant cuz I never spent that much for a machine! But it's worth it! Sews like a dream, so far!!! Love the chart on the top cover! Easy guide to lengths, widths, stitch patterns and what foot to use! I love that it came with quite a few different feet neatly stored at the top. Overall I'm in love with this machine!
customer_reviews.author: BookHound

customer_reviews.title: Good machine
customer_reviews.text: Great machine used it mostly sewing denim and has the necessary power to sew thru thick layers, of course I made the mistake at first not to purchase needles that are meant for denim sewing, broke them, but now with the right needles I have no problems
customer_reviews.author: tanksleepy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well built
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this gift for my mother, and I occasionally use it. No complaints yet. Sturdy and well built.
customer_reviews.author: doza

customer_reviews.title: So far it sews great!
customer_reviews.text: My 30 year old Kenmore sewing machine finally decided it had enough and I purchased this machine to replace it. I do some craft projects but the main sewing is repairing winter horse blankets, which are very thick (nylon liner, 1" fiberfill and a heavy waterproof material). I use jean patches to hold the material together before I sew with the triple zig-zag stitch and this machine handles it with ease! I do have to help it when I add the nylon/cotton web straps to the thickness but that is normal. I've had the machine for 5 days and repaired 10 blankets and put a hem roll on a silk craft project and so far it is meeting my expectations!
customer_reviews.author: cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed at the thought of returning /exchanging as I'm smack ...
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm enjoying it, except that the reverse button doesn't seem to be engaging. Very disappointed at the thought of returning /exchanging as I'm smack dab in the middle of a project.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn O.

customer_reviews.title: I love this machine
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine! Great heavy duty sewing machine. I use this machine to sew bags and it can sew thru layers of material and leather with no problems. Automatic threaded is a big plus. I would highly recommend this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Martin

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Lived up to my expectations. Compares to my 37 year old Kenmore.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The machine works great. Was hoping that different presser feet would have been included.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Leyen

customer_reviews.title: Beware the Warranty!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this machine when I first got it, but just 6 months after purchase the clutch or gears have gone out, it makes an awful grinding noise and doesn't work. I use it for fairly heavy duty sewing, but nothing the company says it shouldn't be able to handle. Then, beware of buying a Janome on Amazon, because if something goes wrong in the first year you can only get it fixed under warranty from the place you bought it from. And you have to pay to ship the broken machine across the country!
customer_reviews.author: E.S.E.E.

customer_reviews.title: Sews through seams on jeans with plenty of power.
customer_reviews.text: Has plenty of power to sew denim and the thick seams when repairing jeans. I used a size 16 needle and it went through the seams very easily. I'm very happy. This is a simple, mechanical machine and it seems perfect for my needs, which are mostly making repairs and doing a few projects.
customer_reviews.author: Ali D

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought my Janome HD 3000 through Amazon from Brubaker's Sewing Center, because Amy Smith of Brubaker's had been so helpful to me when I called with questions about various Janome models. I would not hesitate to recommend the HD3000 to anyone who wants a portable, durable, heavy duty mechanical sewing machine. I wanted it for sewing and repairing garments and for other sewing projects, such as making slipcovers and curtains. I used it first for sewing curtains out of heavy cotton canvas, and it negotiated thick seams with ease.
customer_reviews.author: EJM

customer_reviews.title: Love my Janome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome machine! Sews delicates and denims with ease. Great machine top storage. Super upper flap that has directions for all stitches and protects The machine from dust. Very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: arline

customer_reviews.title: I really like the Janome
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Janome. It replaces a 25 year old Kenmore. I don't like the way the spool of thread is positioned, but maybe all the new machines have them lay down. It sews like a dream and I really like being able to see the bobbin thread. It does vibrate, so I bought a muffling mat which really takes care of the problem. Hopefully I will rated it even higher when I become more accustomed to it. I'm pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Schnauzers Rule

customer_reviews.title: sews heavy materials easily, simple to adjust settings
customer_reviews.text: Everything they claimed; solid construction, quiet, sews heavy materials easily, simple to adjust settings.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Good machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a good sewing machine. I bought it as an investment in my wife's business. She has gotten a lot of use out of it. There have been a few hiccups but nothing that hasn't been able to be fixed or worked through with an internet or YouTube search. The price was really good as well.
customer_reviews.author: HPSS_Genius

customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed. Takes care of the finer fabric and I can sew heavy duty projects.
customer_reviews.author: Jones

customer_reviews.title: It can go through multiple thick layers like butter! Love this machine
customer_reviews.text: This machine is a WORKHORSE!!! I've had it for awhile now and mostly make multi-layer rag quilts with it. It can go through multiple thick layers like butter! Love this machine!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy M

customer_reviews.title: Only Goes In Reverse
customer_reviews.text: So far it's a piece of dog doo. I ran the first stitches and it only runs in reverse! I needed this machine to finish a project and now I have to wait for a replacement. I am so mad!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Hill

customer_reviews.title: love it.
customer_reviews.text: love it ..... sews like a dream better than my old kenmore from 1969 that I thought I would never find as good a replacement for when it finally gave out
customer_reviews.author: Karen Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Pretty fragile for a heavy duty machine
customer_reviews.text: Works great on many materials but not thick leather. It will do the job on thin leather but all of the advanced features are too much and would rather just have a solid sewing machine that doesn’t break down. After using it 3 times something has come unhooked in the machine and I can no longer change the stitch settings. Now I have to bring it in to get fixed :/
customer_reviews.author: Robbie SHeets

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great sewing machine. intuitive to use. Lots of built in stitches. Easily sews through 3 layers of webbing.
customer_reviews.author: joel moritz jr.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great machine, heavy duty, best price I wouldnt think twice about buying here again. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: barbara towery

customer_reviews.title: Good machine
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use; also all the presser foots have a place right on top of the machine. So convenient! Not quite as "heavy duty" as I thought... struggles through really heavy, multi-layered materials. If you want a good selection of embroidery/decorative stitches, it only offers a limited amount... Still, well worth the buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Helene North

customer_reviews.title: I am more than pleased with the purchase of my Janome HD3000
customer_reviews.text: This is everything and more than I thought it would be. I am more than pleased with the purchase of my Janome HD3000.
customer_reviews.author: Susan DeGroot

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had absolutely no problems with the machine. Sews new hems in jeans. Repaired the open seams on our boat top. What more can I ask for? Easy to use and the machine feet store right in the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine B.

customer_reviews.title: Sews great on leather
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for 2 months now. Sews great on leather, but today I wanted to sew on buttons. I studied the manual, looked at youtube videos and tried to find support on the janome website. I cannot get this machine to zigzag. hmm. This is my fourth sewing machine, singer, kenmore and and Elna I've been using since 1990. Any suggestions?
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Yanko

customer_reviews.title: Machine go nice and smooth from fabric to fabric
customer_reviews.text: I been using Janome HD3000 for one month. I made 3 different projects so far (garments). Was using silk, lace, leather and very heavy linen. Machine go nice and smooth from fabric to fabric. Many layers do not create any significant problems. I am very happy with my new sewing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Inna A Ordway

customer_reviews.title: Youtube has a great demo created by a dealer ( http
customer_reviews.text: The more my fiancé uses the HD3000, the more feature rich and rugged this beast becomes. Youtube has a great demo created by a dealer (  )...this showed us some uses/features that we didn't know it was capable of.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Basic machine without a lot of electronic
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Basic machine without a lot of electronic, computerized things to go wrong (and, which are expensive or impossible to fix).
customer_reviews.author: Diane M. Martin

customer_reviews.title: The only feature I didn't like was the reverse button which doesn't engage continuously but ...
customer_reviews.text: The Janome HD3000 seems to be comparable to my old Singer Touch snd Sew, but I've used it only to hem some courderoy jeans. It required some hand cranking to get through six layers at the flat felled seams, but I had to do that with the Touch and Sew as well. The only feature I didn't like was the reverse button which doesn't engage continuously but has to be held down which means that I can guide the fabric with only one hand. Next time I'm going to insert some rubber tubing in the reverse button so it will be continuously engaged.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Couture

customer_reviews.title: Simply Amazing
customer_reviews.text: All the positive reviews are accurate for this machine. We are thoroughly impressed although there is another seller offering the same one with extra stuff. We wish we would have seen that before ordering! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua L. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!!!!! Description could have included more features I found very nice: the area designed to store the extra feet, the storage area in the front of the machine, and the needle threading feature.... all very pleasant surprises!!!
customer_reviews.author: Vicki R. Cope

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this machine
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this machine. I sew professionally and this is the perfect machine to supplement my workroom. Very easy to control stitch precision and speed. It did not handle bulky fabric layers as easily as the industrial machine though. It purrs like a kitten and it is just as friendly. I would recommend this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Linda S. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: I really like it. Having some problems with the bobbins (the ...
customer_reviews.text: Still getting used to this but so far, I really like it. Having some problems with the bobbins (the machine is so fast that the thread isn't always evenly distributed onto the bobbin when filling it).
customer_reviews.author: Diane L.

product_meta.title: Janome HD3000 Heavy-Duty Sewing Machine with 18 Built-In Stitches + Hard Case
product_meta.description: HD-3000 Heavy Duty Features: -18 Stitches. -One-step buttonhole. -Built-in needle threader. -Snap-on presser feet. -Push-pull bobbin winder. -Extra high presser foot left. Product Type: -Mechanical sewing machine. Light Included: -Yes. Free Arm: -Yes. Needle Threading System: -Manual. Reverse Stitching: -Yes. Automatic Bobbin Winding: -Yes. Case/Cover Included: -Yes. Thread Tension Adjustment: -Yes. Case/Cover Type: -Carrying case. Thread Tension Adjustment Type: -Manual. Dimensions: -Maximum stitch: 6.5mm W x 4mm L. Overall Height - Top to Bottom: -15". Overall Width - Side to Side: -19". Overall Depth - Front to Back: -10".
